item.title: Valkyrae Throws Shade at Jason Momoa After Alleged Incident on Minecraft Movie Set
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Valkyrae shares harsh criticisms about her experience with Jason Momoa during filming on the set of A Minecraft Movie.
  • Valkyrae details an incident in which Jason Momoa was overly loud and angry with the members of the crew for the film, yelling and acting aggressive with the staff.
  • Valkyrae confirmed she is set to appear in a cameo role in A Minecraft Movie with its theatrical release in April.

Valkyrae has harsh words about Jason Momoa, one of the stars of the upcoming A Minecraft Movie , following an alleged incident that occurred during filming for the movie. The movie based on the beloved sandbox survival game is one that has been rumored for years, following the game's explosion in popularity throughout the 2010s. Legendary Pictures and Warner Bros. would officially debut the first teaser trailer for the Minecraft movie earlier this month, giving fans their first look at Jack Black in the starring role as Steve. However, one actor involved with the project now finds themselves in hot water.

The highly-anticipated first trailer for A Minecraft Movie has largely been panned by both fans and critics following its release. Many fans have criticized the artstyle and CGI used within the movie, with some even calling some of the designs "horrifying" or "unsettling" for its intended child audience. The film's casting has also been the subject of discussion among fans of Minecraft , poking fun at Jack Black's role as Steve and the live-action interpretation of the pixelated game. Now, Jason Momoa's behavior on set is being called out by a popular streamer.

As reported by Dexerto, popular streamer Valkyrae shared her horror story about Jason Momoa during an interview about her time in the film. Valkyrae confirmed she is set to appear in a cameo role within A Minecraft Movie , detailing an incident involving Jason Momoa mistreating the crew working on the movie. The streamer revealed that Momoa was "angry and loudly yelling" at members of the crew for the film, calling it her worst experience with a celebrity. Jason Momoa plays Garrett "The Garbage Man" Garrison, one of the main characters in A Minecraft Movie .

Valkyrae Shares Harsh Remarks About Jason Momoa

Valkyrae's cameo role in A Minecraft Movie come as the beloved streamer has often appeared in films and television shows, following her rise as a content creator. Valkyrae appears as herself in Mark Wahlberg's 2023 action comedy The Family Plan , as well as Squad Commander Red in Netflix 's Sonic Prime animated series. Valkyrae is a co-owner of gaming and esports organization 100 Thieves, while she also co-hosted the annual Streamer Awards in 2023 alongside QTCinderella.

Valkyrae's scathing remarks about Jason Momoa serve to further embroil A Minecraft Movie in controversy following its official reveal. The film has been subjected to numerous delays throughout its production cycle, first scheduled to premiere as early as 2019. A Minecraft Movie has also seen several negative comparisons to the recently revealed Sonic the Hedgehog 3 , with the Sonic film highly praised for its more mature tones and casting of Keanu Reeves as Shadow the Hedgehog. A Minecraft Movie 's early struggles may look to continue with its most recent controversy.

item.title: Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake Has Gone Gold
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake goes gold, ready for release on November 14 for multiple platforms.
  • The remake offers updated visuals, new additions, and improvements while staying true to the classic RPG roots.
  • More Dragon Quest remakes are on the way.

The upcoming Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake has reportedly gone gold following a social media announcement confirming that the game is ready to be shipped and distributed on release day. A much-anticipated remake of the Super Nintendo classic, Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake is set to launch on November 14 for the Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

Dragon Quest is an all-time classic in the realm of JRPGs, having pioneered many of the elements of modern turn-based role-playing games throughout the series while managing to stay successful, both critically and commercially. Developer Square Enix announced a remake of Dragon Quest 3 to honor the series' 35th anniversary, and though things were quiet for a bit about the upcoming game, fans can rejoice at the latest news.

A Twitter post from the official Dragon Quest account confirmed that Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake has gone gold, meaning that the game is fully finished and ready for shipment when it releases on November 14. The post contained an image of series co-creator Yuji Horii alongside the remake's producer, Masaaki Hayasaka, posing triumphantly while holding copies of the new game.

Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake Officially Goes Gold

Fans were excited in the replies, with many stating that they had already pre-ordered the game and would be looking forward to playing it on release day, while others expressed concerns about the game's alleged censorship of certain character models. Updated character designs are not the only new addition to the Dragon Quest 3 remake, however, as the game will also see the addition of a brand-new vocation and a few changes to the main story.

Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake is ready to hit the shelves in two months, giving longtime fans a fresh take on the classic game and providing a modernized version for new fans to check out for the first time. Additionally, the game will seemingly be the first of several remakes to come, as Square Enix reportedly plans to remake the first two Dragon Quest games in a similar manner in the future.

Of course, many fans are still waiting with bated breath for an announcement regarding the previously revealed Dragon Quest 12 , which Square Enix also teased at the 35th anniversary livestream event. There is still no solid information as to when that game might release, but in the meantime, Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D promises a return to the classic era of Dragon Quest with more modern visuals and major graphical and quality of life upgrades.

item.title: When Games Turn Into Movie Scenes #35
item.description: A collection of movie-style clips from games like Sea of Thieves, Hell Let Loose, Starfield, and more.

item.title: Deadlock: Best Shiv Build
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Items For Shiv In Deadlock
  • Shiv Skill Priorities

Shiv is a hero with a penchant for making his own opportunities in Deadlock . His kit revolves around bleeding enemies out before swooping in for the kill. This character is fairly flexible with many potential build paths that focus on his different strengths and weaknesses.

The following is a build that capitalizes on the pressure Shiv can apply in-lane with his Bleed DoT, which can keep the enemy's HP just low enough for Shiv to pounce on them. This is what makes him one of the best heroes in Deadlock , and this build should serve as a good starting point for players who have just started trying him out.

Best Items For Shiv In Deadlock

Shiv's playstyle is all about weakening the enemy before diving in hard for the kill . He does this by pelting his opponents with his Serrated Knives and dashing into their faces with Slice and Dice before blasting them with his shotgun. If that isn't enough, he can finish off any survivors with his Ultimate, Killing Blow , to secure the kill. The following focuses more on stacking Spirit Power and cooldown reduction so Shiv can spam his knives all game.

Laning Phase

Weapon

  • Close Quarters

Vitality

  • Enduring Spirit
  • Extra Stamina
  • Healing Rite (optional)

Spirit

  • Extra Charge
  • Mystic Vulnerability
  • Mystic Burst

Get Extra Charge as your first item for the extra throwing knife, then follow up with Mystic Vulnerability, so your knives deal more damage. Get Mystic Burst as your third item to make Slice and Dice hit harder.

Close Quarters improves your all-in potential by granting more damage while at close range, and it's great if you're fighting another close-ranged Deadlock character like Pocket. Meanwhile, the Vitality items provide you with the means to stay alive during the laning phase.

Core Items

Weapon

  • Soul Shredder Bullets
  • Slowing Bullets
  • Close Quarters

Vitality

  • Spirit Lifesteal
  • Healbane
  • Extra Stamina

Spirit

  • Improved Cooldown
  • Mystic Vulnerability
  • Rapid Charge
  • Improved Burst

This is what your item build is expected to look like come mid-game. Sell any of the laning items if you need additional slots, or upgrade them if possible. The order in which you buy these items mainly depends on how the game is going:

  • If you're winning, purchase the Spirit items first.
  • If you're losing, get Spirit Lifesteal and Soul Shredder Bullets.

Healbane is a great item on Shiv even if the enemy team doesn't have heroes with strong healing. Since Shiv tends to take a lot of damage, the heal-on-kill portion of Healbane can come in handy in clutch situations, especially since his third skill, Bloodletting, defers a portion of the damage Shiv takes. Healbane and lifesteal can keep Bloodletting from killing you.

Luxury Items and Flex Slots

In the late game, a fed Shiv should be able to quickly burst down priority Deadlock heroes like Infernus or anyone else who has low health. Many of the items players should buy at this stage of the game are upgraded versions of Core items or ones that improve Shiv's survivability.

  • Point Blank: Deal even more damage when in close range, and apply Slow with your bullets within that range.
  • Siphon Bullets: Gain max HP when hitting enemies with your bullets. Gain a stack of max HP when you defeat a target, and lose two stacks if you die.
  • Leech: Grants 35% increased Bullet and Spirit Lifesteal, along with bonus Weapon Damage, Spirit Power, and Health.
  • Superior Stamina: Purchase this if you want more dodge charges.
  • Bullet/Spirit Armor: Buy and upgrade according to whoever hurts the most in the enemy team.
  • Mystic Slow: Slows enemy movement speed and fire rate when they take Spirit damage.
  • Escalating Exposure: Dealing Spirit damage applies a stacking Spirit Amp, increasing the Spirit damage taken by your target.
  • Mystic Reverb: Imbue an ability to inflict Slow and deal a second burst of Spirit damage to your target after a short while. Use this on Slice and Dice.
  • Improved Spirit: More Spirit, Health Regen, Sprint Speed, and Health. Can be upgraded to Boundless Spirit for even more stats.

Since this build mainly focuses on Spirit Power, players should get the Spirit items on this list first if they're winning the game. If not, save up for Leech and Armor items.

Shiv Skill Priorities

Unlock Serrated Knife first, then put one upgrade point into it for an extra knife charge . After that, get Slice and Dice and upgrade it twice for the extra burst damage. Put your next two points into Bloodletting and Killing Blow, then save the rest for either Serrated Knife or Slice and Dice.

Shiv's skill priorities are pretty versatile, but if you want to establish early-mid-game dominance, max out Serrated Knife after getting the second Slice and Dice upgrade. This increases both the impact damage and DoT of your knives, softening enemies up quicker for Slice and Dice and Killing Blow.

item.title: How Remedy's Latest Control 2 Announcement Could Lead to Fun Easter Eggs
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Remedy has complex connections between its IPs, building a coherent universe.
  • Remedy partnering with Annapurna allows for more Easter eggs in future projects.
  • Remedy's collaboration on films/TV should feature Annapurna game references.

Remedy Entertainment has taken the time and care to craft the Remedy Connected Universe which blends its different IPs. Officially, only Alan Wake and Control are part of the RCU, but keen-eyed players can spot references to other Remedy games such as Quantum Break . These connections help the Remedy games feel like a coherent piece of art.

Remedy has another chance to include even more Easter eggs in Control 's sequel thanks to its collaboration with Annapurna. It would be nice if the upcoming games, films, and television series featured references to Annapurna's rich library of games, to celebrate both companies' successes and the potential in their new relationship.

Remedy's History With Easter Eggs

Remedy has never been one to shy away from featuring Easter eggs from its other games. This goes as far back as Quantum Break , which features references to Night Springs and even a blackboard outlining the convoluted plot of Alan Wake. For casual players, these are easy to overlook, but veteran fans will notice them immediately.

The Remedy Connected Universe expands with the AWE DLC for Control which features Alan Wake interacting with Jesse Faden. Through this connection, players learn more about Bright Falls and the events that took place in the first Alan Wake game. The connections continue in Alan Wake 2 , where FBI agent Saga Anderson interacts with FBC agent Kiran Esteves. Saga shows that she is more than capable of keeping up with the FBC agents, which may hint at further collaborations in the future.

Quantum Break Also Makes an Appearance

Remedy is fond of going crazy with its references to past games, even if they aren't part of the Remedy Connected Universe. This is seen with the appearance of Alex Casey, who bears a striking resemblance to Max Payne of the franchise of the same name. Sheriff Tim Breaker also makes an appearance, and he is played by the same actor who appeared in Quantum Break .

Remedy Has An Opportunity to Include Plenty of Annapurna References

Remedy has struck a deal with Annapurna to bring Control and Alan Wake to film and television. This is an exciting prospect that could see the world of the Remedy Connected Universe expanded. Annapurna has a rich library of games it has published and developed. This includes titles like What Remains of Edith Finch , Stray , Flower , Journey , Outer Wilds , and Twelve Minutes , to name but a few. It would be a simple task for Remedy to include Easter eggs referencing these many games.

This could be done by featuring characters from past Annapurna games, and this could be as trivial as including the Stray cat, which wouldn't impede on the story but would still provide a nice Easter egg for long-time Annapurna fans. The possibilities are limitless, so long as Remedy and Annapurna are willing to be creative. The biggest problem would be finding a way to naturally include these varied characters from Annapurna's roster while still having things feel natural and unforced. Fortunately, Remedy has shown that it has strong creative muscles, and it could make the plan work.

It may seem like there's been a wrench thrown into the works, as Annapurna Interactive's staff has recently resigned. However, Remedy's Thomas Puha has assured gamers that this won't affect the collaboration and that all things are still going according to plan. This is good news for fans who are eagerly awaiting to see the Remedy Connected Universe expand across different mediums. Until then, players can look forward to Control 2, which is still in development and is scheduled to release on PC, PS5 and Xbox Series X/S.
